briefdescription.para: Current batch step, alias for batchSize - 1.
Current gradient step to keep track of the backpropagate through time step.
Bias between the input and gate.
Weights between the input and gate.
Weights between the output and gate.
Number of steps to backpropagate through time (BPTT).

memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t inSize, const size_t outSize, const size_t rho=std::numeric_limits< size_t >::max())
memberdef.name: FastLSTM

briefdescription.para: Create the Fast LSTM layer object using the specified parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum number of steps to backpropagate through time (BPTT).

briefdescription.para: Ordinary feed backward pass of a neural network, calculating the function f(x) by propagating x backwards trough f.

detaileddescription.para: Using the results from the feed forward pass.

briefdescription.para: Ordinary feed forward pass of a neural network, evaluating the function f(x) by propagating the activity forward through f.

parameterdescription.para: Input data used for evaluating the specified function.

briefdescription.para: Get the shape of the input.
Get the number of input units.
Get the number of output units.
Get the maximum number of steps to backpropagate through time (BPTT).
Modify the maximum number of steps to backpropagate through time (BPTT).
Get the size of the weight matrix.
This speeds up the sigmoid operation by using an approximation.

parameterdescription.para: The matrix to store the sigmoid approximation into.

briefdescription.para: Sigmoid approximation for the given sample.

parameterdescription.para: The given data sample for the sigmoid approximation.

briefdescription.para: An implementation of a faster version of the Fast LSTM network layer.

detaileddescription.para: Basically by combining the calculation of the input, forget, output gates and hidden state in a single step. The standard formula changes as follows:

para.formula: \begin{eqnarray} i &=& sigmoid(W \cdot x + W \cdot h + b) \\ f &=& sigmoid(W \cdot x + W \cdot h + b) \\ z &=& tanh(W \cdot x + W \cdot h + b) \\ c &=& f \cdot c + i \cdot z \\ o &=& sigmoid(W \cdot x + W \cdot h + b) \\ h &=& o \cdot tanh(c) \end{eqnarray}

detaileddescription.para: Note that FastLSTM network layer does not use peephole connections between the cell and gates.
Note also that if a FastLSTM layer is desired as the first layer of a neural network, an IdentityLayer should be added to the network as the first layer, and then the FastLSTM layer should be added.
For more information, see the following.

simplesect.para: LSTM for a standard implementation of the LSTM layer.

parameterdescription.para: Type of the input data (arma::colvec, arma::mat, arma::sp_mat or arma::cube).
Type of the output data (arma::colvec, arma::mat, arma::sp_mat or arma::cube).
